Reviews.Title: “A Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeremy21558
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on the way back from India. Arrived late at night (about 1am) and while reception OK there was some confusion over what exactly I was suposed to pay for. I think that they should take more care with guests arriving tired and jet lagged in the early hours of the morning. The problem as I discovered was payment for breakfast which when it arrived the next morning in our room I had to pay for on the spot rather than be able to charge it to a room bill as I had not given a credit card when I arrived. This was annoying when you are wrapped up in a towel and your wife is lying in bed wondering was is going on while your breakfast is going cold. Apart from that the hotel is fine given that it is a airport hotel, rooms are large and comfortable and even with a front facing room I did not hear any street noise. Did not try restuarant as was out in the evening but looked OK. The bar was busy in the evening when I got back with what seemed to be non residents which is odd for an airport hotel but ...... If I was overnighting in Dubai I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Emirates airways put us up as their delay caused us to miss our connecting flight!”
Reviews.Author: lizjuric
Reviews.Content: It's close to airport, clean and rooms are a decent size. It's in airport area so a little far from the Dubai attractions or the convenient metro and shopping! This hotel is perfect for stays if using Dubai as a hub for your connecting flights!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for overnight stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: Jim255350
Reviews.Content: Close to airport with hotel shuttle service. My wife and I stayed just one night in transit between Europe and Australia. It served its function for us however the late flight arrival and early departure made the event less than relaxing and that was no fault of the hotel - the few hours we had here didn't really justify the cost. To benefit from a break in the 20 plus hour flight time from Europe to Australia it really needs more time than we allowed.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice transit hotel 5 minutes away from airport”
Reviews.Author: Frans G Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Been here once for my regular travel for work. I guess Emirates had a good choice for this hotel as partner for their transit passenger. Room was quite nice and cozy, breakfast included and it was ok, and it's only 5 minutes away from the airport. The hotel provide transportation to the airport back and forward every 15 minutes (if I'm not wrong). The hotel was quite busy as this is mostly use as transit hotel and sometimes difficult to find a table at breakfast time or you can just share the table with the other people.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MDtravelinglady
Reviews.Content: This isn't a bad place to stay since it's so close to the hotel, I won't stay here again when I come back for regular holiday though. The staff at the front desk and concierge gentleman have been incredibly helpful in getting me where I need to be for emergency dental appointments. However, there are definitely some down sides to staying here. My bed came from the Flintstone era...it's literally HARD AS A ROCK and incredibly uncomfortable. The curved couch is far more comfortable and have spent more time sleeping on that then the bed it self. Also they don't use a top sheet on the bed which is kind of gross considering that the bedspread touches everyone that crawls into it...ewwww!!! I will definitely take the couch over that any day. Overall the rooms are clean but they do have nightclub/bar area that has live bands and they also have another bar that you can hear the music VERY CLEARLY through the floors and the windows. My room faces the pool, which is unavailable since it's being fixed or remodeled at the moment. Definitely ask for a room that farther up than the 1 or 2 floors so you avoid the music. Roomservice breakfast is a bit expensive and OMG they bring you a TON of food, it's crazy. The little English Pub has great kabobs and okay fish/chips and again it's a bit pricey, but I guess that's to be expected. Didn't try the other restaurants in the hotel so can't comment on them

Reviews.Title: “Soulless and poor room-to-room soundproofing, but adequate for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: tint7003
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night in January before my flight out. I was allocated a room on the second floor which was very large and faced out to the front of the hotel where there was some road noise. Although close to the airport, flight noise was minimal. The room and bathroom was a little dated - no flat screen TV, ironing board or tea and coffee making facilities. I tried to buy a cappuccino at the hotel's coffee bar to take back to my room but annoyingly they don't offer take out. I walked for a few minutes either side of the hotel but it's very isolated and there were no coffee shop alternatives close by. The sound proofing between the rooms is very poor and the guy next door to me with the really bad cough sounded like he was actually in my room. Our rooms had a connecting door which probably didn't help. Check-out next morning was efficient, as was the hotel's complimentary transfer to the airport. Staff were rather charmless like the hotel itself, but I've stayed in worst airport hotels and for a short layover this one does the job, just about.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an airport hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Stan040
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for a night here, due to a delayed flight. The hotel is clean and the rooms are very spacious. The food in the main restaurant is good too - we had a very good Arabic buffet (especially the sweets were excellent). On certain days during the week there are theme nights / life band. The hotel is 5 minutes walk away from the Dubai Subway, which connects you to all the main attractions. The infrastructure around the hotel itself is not yet well developed.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: colinallum
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is convenient for the Airport, modern and comfortable at, for Dubai, reasonable charges. Considerably cheaper than the local alternatives I would not hesitate to recommend it for that quick business trip -but not really suitable for the holidaymaker.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: almoe07
Reviews.Content: good location quite rooms and good service for Breakfast Made sure I got for my flt departure.

Reviews.Title: “Average for its price”
Reviews.Author: Alibek M
Reviews.Content: *** This review is based on my stay in deluxe room, Jan 13-14 (incl breakfast). *** Last week, I had a short stopover in Dubai, and was looking for hotel with rooms below $150. Considering I only had a day, my search was narrowed to DXB (T3) vicinity, and Millennium Airport Hotel seemed like a way to go. Finding hotel was easy, given it has own booth down the arrivals hall in Dubai Intl, T3. From there, a complimentary hotel transfer is available, and I waited less than 10 mins before the bus arrived. Once on, it took us ~ 5 minutes to reach hotel. Checking in was fast and easy, and staff at the reception desk was quite competent. Overall, the service is alright, albeit not really caring nor attentive. I haven't seen any doormen and/or porters to move my luggage - things expected from a true 4 star hotel. The room, on the other hand, has pleasantly surprised me with sheer space and middle eastern motifs in décor. Everything, from ample storage room to scarlet carpeting and king size bed oozed luxury - though not matched by the quality of furniture. I did like the large, floor-to-ceiling window and the desk. A corner sofa with round coffee table were well placed. The in-room Internet is priced from 8 USD / 30 mins, and lobby DOES NOT have free Wi-Fi. I cannot really blame the hotel though, since in Dubai, even Starbucks doesn't offer any. I also hope that hotel management would also consider including a pair of slippers and a comb - even the cheapest onces - into their deluxe rooms. They cost next to nothing, but add a lot of functionality to an otherwise very good hotel. RATING: 3/4 for now.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable overnight”
Reviews.Author: TrippingAllOver
Reviews.Content: This hotel must specialize in holding passengers for a stopover and sending them off at odd times of the night. Nice looking hotel, large clean rooms, good food is available all the time, wake up call, fast check in (even with long line up) and check out. But the hotel is less helpful with non-routine requests. Like making a local phone call. There is only one phone at front desk so people line up to use it, and you have to pay front desk staff for the call when you finish. I guess they don't want guests to rack up a bill. Front desk couldn't hold some books for us so a friend could pick them up the next day. We decided to pay a taxi to deliver the books to our friend. Other than that, overnight stay was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: ngman
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night with an early departure...so, you'd assume I was looking for a restful night's sleep. Reception didn't think so - they put me in a room above the disco (open unitl 3am on a Monday night!) - the floor vibrated. So I changed rooms, except the hotel didn't tell the largel hairy man who had a keycard for the room and thought it was his. Breakfast started at 6am - too late for me, although room service was reasonable and quick. Rooms are large but rather tired looking. The hotel's expensive for what it is (a transit hotel) and does not represent value for money. One good thing was the free shuttle to the airport - this was the only silver lining I found.

Reviews.Title: “Just in transit”
Reviews.Author: Cunillu
Reviews.Content: Nothing special, it is OK if you are in transit in Dubai, room are quite big and comfortable, as per 4-5 star Hotel in Dubai. Rooms are clean. The breakfast and services are typical for transit hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelcat2005
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews, I had to think twice before booking it. We booked a standard room. The part of the hotel we stayed in (room 314) appeared new. It was apparently recently refurbished. Everything was clean, fresh - good beds, etc. When we entered the hotel, it was a pleasant surprise. Nice lobby, friendly staff. We arrived at 11:00 a.m. and expected to leave our luggage and return 4 hours later. Instead, we were told that the room would be available at 11:30 a.m. We waited in the lobby -- they walked over to us to let us know when the room was ready (a little before 11:30 a.m.) Both the room and bathroom were large and well appointed. I would rate the room 5 stars without hesitation. Since the hotel rennovation is continuing (swimming pool and areas around it are completely torn up), it does reflect in the rating Since this is an "airport" hotel, it does not seem fair to rate it on being able to hear planes taking off. The hotel is on a busy street and that noise was very well muted. The airplanes were more like background noise and did not disrupt our sleep. Not impressed with the restaurant Biggles -- will rate that separately. The Blue Elephant Thai restaurant in the hotel across the street was great!

Reviews.Title: “great as a stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: may043
Reviews.Content: we stayed at millenium hotel dubai for a night as a stopover. the airport shuttle was on time and it took us five min to get to the hotel. chek in staff were quite efficient as it was a busy time at the hotel but we were allocated rooms qiute speedily. the rooms are comfortable, spacious with lovely bathrooms. my family and i didnt here the band/music/parties as other reviewers wrote about. i was actually listening out for the noise as i read about it here. the breakfast, lunch and dinner was superb! the hotel is excellently located behind GGICO station. overall a great experience with friendly staff who make sure you chek out on time to make your connecting flight!

Reviews.Title: “Nice treat especially for a night's rest”
Reviews.Author: NevilleCalleja
Reviews.Content: I was given a complimentary night at the Millenium Airport Hotel by Emirates due to an overnight stopover on the way to New Zealand. I didn't know what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised to find this huge and very comfortable hotel. The rooms were quite large and upmarket. Breakfast was included and was a plentiful buffet. The only pity was that, during the night, the shuttles from Dubai Airport to the hotel were not that frequent even though there were a substantial number of people waiting - I spent around 40 mins waiting for a shuttle and that wasn't very nice at 2.30am after passing through 4 different queues in the airport to be cleared.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not here if you want some comfort, rest and sleep”
Reviews.Author: Anand N
Reviews.Content: A group of us recently stayed here for two nights, and never again! Although the rooms were clean, the downside is that the hotel runs disco every night up to 3am. None of us could get any decent sleep at all with the constant resonance from speakers of the disco two floors below and that did not cease until after 3am! After our persistent complaints the management finally offered us another room (smoking room instead of non-smoking) 2 floors up, but insisted that we must move our unpacked luggage there at the same time as well --- and that was at 1am. That was certainly not acceptable to us as we are already that tired from lack of sleep plus we had to get up early to catch an early morning flight from the airport. I found out from the hotel staff that this issue has been a constant complaints from guests, but management seems to ignore the issue. I cannot see how a hotel could mix it with disco at such ungodly hour and expect the guests to have any decent rest,

Reviews.Title: “Next year better”
Reviews.Author: huys25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as full day and overnight stop for a connecting flight. The entire outside and pool area was under reconstruction and the gym was a corner in the parking cellar. Both will probably be improved next year when the new wing is finished. Breakfast was reasonable. The bar-pub Biggles next to the lobby was a full smoking facility, with dirty ashtray smell as soon as you enter. The Italian restaurant seemed to be quite nice as it also had some non-curry or spicy dishes. The Internet or WiFi has to be paid additionally for this luxory hotel. Safe box and tea-coffee maker in the room. The entire entourage of the hotel is rather dull, but the room was adequate and quiet. The service bali was helpful and we visited the recently opened Burj Kalifa tower. You can get to about halfway up and the telescope is a waste. Good transport service to the airport. The sky line-metro to town is nearby, walking a hondred meter half over a building site.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience with a bad aftertaste”
Reviews.Author: marquisedesanges_11
Reviews.Content: As much as I enjoyed my brief stay at the hotel while waiting for my flight to UK (service and facilities are very nice and perfect for a transit traveler)- I feel I have to report an incident that completely spoiled my experience in Dubai altogether. In the morning I was supposed to fly to London, I was provided a Millenium hotel shuttle bus to go to the airport. Although the trip to the airport from the hotel is quite short - the driver took almost 40 minutes to drive me to my Terminal. During the trip he asked me a number of inappropriate in any circumstances questions. Although I made it clear that I was not at all comfortable with that type of conversation, he continued harassing me with questions of a sexual nature also making comments about the way I looked and things I "should be doing with my body". As if this experience wasn't horrific enough (and believe me- being alone on a bus with such a person- I wasn't sure I was going to make my flight), the driver started asking me what I was prepared to give him for his kind guide services (he was driving me around the airport for half an hour). I told him I had nothing to give and asked again politely to be let out at the airport. He stopped the bus, got off his seat and started closing the curtains in the bus - then asking me to join him at the back of the bus so that he "could give me a hug". At that point I demanded to be let out of the bus - which thankfully he did and I ran for the hills. This feedback is by no means intended at bringing down the general service quality of Millenium hotel - I enjoyed my stay both on the way to and from UK- but I do believe that incidents like that undermine it all.

Reviews.Title: “Rather past its prime”
Reviews.Author: LesleyLeVaud
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and welcoming. Heavy woodworking now looking rather tatty in the room. Shabby and dusty. Not helped by construction work around the hotel. Hard rather utilitarian bed and an ancient television set in the room (and I could hear the one next door). I had to do some hard negotiating to get the promised kettle, cups and coffee placed in my room. However the Italian restaurant was a very pleasant surprise...great service, lovely food and an old library feel to the place! Free shuttle to the airport very useful. When I read the other reviews I wondered if we had stayed at the same hotel; perhaps some rooms had been renovated and others hadn't!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isam R
Reviews.Content: Not an excellent hotel compared to other hotels in Dubai but it is good enough for travelers who have connecting flights and spending only few hours to half a day. Free food, free water and free shuttle from and to the airport. The room was clean and had almost all the basics that you need in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and a little Luxury integrated”
Reviews.Author: jjokwalinga
Reviews.Content: Serene, and lavish hotel with excellent customer service. Comfort guaranteed

Reviews.Title: “I would love to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Zafrul_Hasan
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious, clean. Food was delicious. I will always love to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnighter”
Reviews.Author: Villius
Reviews.Content: This was the best value hotel I have ever stayed in. Becuase Emirates Airline arranged it free! Nice room, good breakfast and smooth transfer to DXB the next day.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel will be lovely when it is finished.”
Reviews.Author: terryhealingstrands
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel to be near our daughter who has moved ro Dubai to work. It was close to the IRish village a courtyard of eateries that was within walking distance. As it was Ramadan while we were there the restaurants and bars in the hotel were closed - they were also working on the construction of a new swimming pool at the rear of the hotel. The room was well appointed and the air-conditioning was excellent -vital when one considers 40 degree heat. The staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfast in the DaVinci restaurant was great. Will stay here again but not in this season.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable for Free!”
Reviews.Author: Pooky_TH
Reviews.Content: With a 6 hours transit stopover, flying with Emirates, in Dubai we were given a room here to rest. Pondered whether to stay in the Emirates lounge at the airport or go to the complementary Millennium hotel and we decided to take up the offer. We only spent a couple of hours here for a quick nap and a shower before heading back to the airport and found the hotel very convenient and clean. Only a 5 minutes drive from the airport and with excellent air conditioning it was a good choice and much better than the first class lounge(Emirates) if you want a nap and a shower. The immigration procedures only took a few minutes to complete and we could come back to the airport and enjoy the lounge whenever we wanted to. If you are offered a free stay here - take it!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice”
Reviews.Author: Ya_Noor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just an average room but its clean and I think at that point (layover) your just tired and want to rest so average is okay. They also offer breakfast, lunch and dinner which is free but very basic. The hotel does offer a shuttle for free around town so thats nice and they also call you to remind you its almost time to go to the airport all of that is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jezz7777
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice and it is very handy to the airport, the rooms are clean and tidy, the service good, the beds firm and comfortable, and the restaraunt/dine-in food very good. One small criticism would be they could have newer TV's. This place is my pick of the two hotels i've stayed at nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Best 5 hour sleep”
Reviews.Author: jeff1996
Reviews.Content: Having had to re route following a delayed Iberia Airlines flight, I found myself in transit from 11:30pm until 7am. Although the business lounge looked excellent and the variety of food on offer sensational, if you need a good sleep then uyou need a bed. The hotel was quickly located leading of the shopping area. Within 3 minutes, the checking was completed and I was in my room. One minute later, there was a knock on the door and a complimentary fruit arrangement and fruit juice delivered. The efficiency was absolutely astounding and should be used as a bench mark for anyone trying to emulate such offerings. PS....The bed was heavenly

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel sans a few things”
Reviews.Author: kirantnath
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on 5th May 2011 on my way home. The hotel was free thanks to Emirates. Let me summarize my experiences in point below. Pros: 1. Very close to the airport 2. Clean and tidy 3. Great buffet for breakfast/lunch/dinner Cons: 1. No free internet in room. Need to pay a HUGE price for it. 2. When I asked for a power plug adapter to charge my laptop, they asked me to buy it from the hotel shop. 3. Not so helpful staff: Since this was the first time for me in Dubai, I asked the reception for some interesting things to see near the hotel and they said that they cannot help me because if they do, the hotel travel agent would get angry with them. They directed me to go to the hotel travel agency for booking tours (of course at a VERY inflated price) if I needed to and that they cannot tell me even the basic things like whats there to see near the hotel, which I could use as a tourist. Strange Politics. One line: If I go to Dubai again, I would stay here if Emirates sponsors this hotel again but I would NEVER pay to stay here and would look for other good hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel just make sure your not over the night club”
Reviews.Author: IMQuinn
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business for 2 nights, great location for the airport. Hotel is currently undergoing a large extension so be aware of that. Also if you are noise sensitive make sure a) you are no where near the night club, which is open to 3am and b) on the back of the hotel, the road outside is busy and rather loud. The hotel kindly changed my room at 2am after 4hrs of trying to sleep with the base coming from the club! So no complaints on the service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stopover but you wouldn't want to pay for it as 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dafne07
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight in this hotel as part of my flight ticket with Emirates as I had long transfer. The hotel is just around the corner from airport. The rooms are spacious and nice. The food (all buffet style, also included) was nice. Free transfer to shopping center is also available. I have really enjoyed my stay. However, I wouldn't classify it as 4* hotel and especially not in Dubai, where I have stayed in some of the best hotels ever. No hairdryer, no tea & coffee amenities in the room, the toiletries were only cheap bar of soap and shampoo in a sachet. No swimming pool. Only few TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the Amenities it provides”
Reviews.Author: RudyP25
Reviews.Content: Service is pretty cold but it is fairly close to the airport. I recommend it for 'Emergency Stopovers' in Dubai because it is very close to the Airport and the pick up and drop off works well enough.

Reviews.Title: “Next time I will choice another one”
Reviews.Author: Fero967
Reviews.Content: After 7 nights in Millennium Abu Dhabi I asked at reception to book me a room in this hotel. He call there and the response was 600AED (in internet they had 299 AED). The receptionist was told, that I have to book it via Internet - strange. Finally I made a booking via Internet (had to use the credit card). After arrival they had to check everything again inclusive the credit card. The price in internet is without the taxis, final price was 360AED.

Reviews.Title: “Clean - great for a layover”
Reviews.Author: SarahJane0488
Reviews.Content: While it's not in the greatest location, it is a typical airport hotel. Nice clean rooms, clean grounds, and decent service. Supper and breakfast buffets good. Helpful staff, but somewhat lazy for a hotel - I got in fairly late, and the concierge desk were hanging out chatting with other hotel staff. When I approached the desk, had to wait for two employees to finish their conversation before being attended to. Stay away from the ATM in the lobby - myself and others had issues and couldn't get it to work. It didn't take out any money, but nervewracking nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “superb service”
Reviews.Author: may043
Reviews.Content: we were lucky enough to have a stopover in dubai at the millenium airport hotel. it was absolutely comforfortable with a clean bathroom and fresh linen. the breakfast, lunch and dinner was excellent with a variety of mouthwatering dishes. the kids loved it and its location is excellent as its only a few minutes from the airport and the dubai metro station is located walking distance away. also, the shuttle service to and from the airport was prompt. we didnt ever need to wait longer than 10 min.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: sarkabarina
Reviews.Content: i am australian female,traveled from vienna to sydney via dubai by myself.as i am attractive blond in my early forties,i was very nervous travelling alone and staying at the "millenium hotel" alone.i had a great experiance!!!hotel was fantastic!!!clean,beautiful,staff very helpfull.my room was great absolutely spotless ,spacious,beautifull bathroom,safe.restaurant was also fantastic-soo much nice food and again great service.I can't wait for my next trip!!i will be staying a lot longer,several days!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, improvements are being worked.”
Reviews.Author: N_FamilyGeorgia
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights here and I can say my stay has been pleasant. Although there is construction going on the operation is satisfactory. The rooms are spacious and very clean, the bathrooms are most comfortable. The restaurant Cactus Jack's has very simple and appealing menu, but beware of any special liquors you order at their bar since they tend to water down the drinks. Just order bottled beer or wine and you should be fine. Room service is timely and has a very positive attitude. Do not arrive too early as this hotel charges an extra $75 early check-in fee before 10a.m. Also, Internet costs $30 a night and is censored. The only down points I would say other than the construction are; 1) Bartenders need better training on liquor preparation, 2) a Spa should be added to make service more complete, and 3) they should control the flow of Call Girls here since as soon as I walk in front of the bar I get hit on by at least three Call Girls who do not understand the word "No".

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay....”
Reviews.Author: kimayaMumbai
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Millenium was for 2 days..in Feb 2011 From the time we booked the hotel, we go an amazing welcome. The ambience of the hotel was just amazing.. a 2 min drive from the airport.. Great hospitality, no hasssles while check out and check inn.. The location of the hotel was just perfect, close to the airport... All in all, it was a v happy experience.

Reviews.Title: “it was really nice and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Nurse93
Reviews.Content: the room is very clean, and the hotel is quite i a good site. there are different restaurants at the hotel. different services. it is near to the airport. close to metro station GI GI CU which connects you with others metros. there is one hospital near by the hotel in addition to have a business centre and internet connect but not wireless. for internet you have to pay for it 50 UAE durham. you can walk to metro station. staff are cooperative and respectable. if you want to leave hotel they arrange care for you to the airport. for food price is ok not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here until it is finished!”
Reviews.Author: GooseWBA
Reviews.Content: See the nice picture of the hotel with swimming pool on the top of this page? Looks nice doesn't it? Unfortunately it does not exist! The hotel is currently having a large extension built. Only one wing is open and the hotel grounds are quite literally a building site. There is no swimming pool at the moment or the landscaped gardens that they advertise. I booked through Trailfinders as I wanted a hotel close to the airport that had a swimming pool so we could take our nearly two year old swimming and keep him occupied in a 1 day stopover between the UK and Australia. Arrived at 3am so did not immediately notice that the view from the window was of a building site! Plus points are that the rooms were clean, of a decent size and the staff were very helpful. Only complaint about the rooms is that there were no tea making facilities in our room, when I asked reception to send us some they told me only superior rooms had this even though their own brochure says all the hotel rooms are equipped tea making facilities. Will be a really good (and big) hotel near the airport when it is finished but until then you should avoid it unless all you want from the hotel is a room for the night as it currently has no other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service.”
Reviews.Author: Jay822
Reviews.Content: After a very long trip to get to Dubai I arrived at the millennium hotel for a nice shower and a rest. Upon checking in I was told 3 different reasons as to why my booking had been canceled! All of them lies! The reason was that it was Dubai shopping festival and they had overbooked by 15 rooms. Normally I wouldn't mind but the way they lied point blank to my face made my blood boil. This has happened many times to coworkers. Needless to say no longer on our approved hotel list!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: orfjara
Reviews.Content: We were put in this Hotel by Emirates Airline due to a missed connection because of a delayed flight. The rooms were poor and had a toxic chemical smell which gave us all headaches and coughs. The manager said it was coming from the Air Conditioning system. The room service was poor we ordered at 6.30pm and finally got our meal at 8.20pm after numerous phone calls. As we were Emirates Business Class passengers we expected better . The last straw was that my Australian dollars were stolen from my travel wallet as I had not transferred them to my purse when we went out to the Mall of the Emirates and had left the wallet in my room. Needless to say I cannot recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Strange”
Reviews.Author: Hazineh
Reviews.Content: Strange hotel with no decor concept, extra large rooms with ugly furniture. No wifi in rooms, only cabled Internet .. Wifi is also not free in lobby. Bad breakfast .. Bar downstairs is ok for a drink or two

Reviews.Title: “Love this Millennium Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tspeiris
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel & Great customer service. Rooms nice, clean and spacious. The restaurant was great. Enjoyed the nice breakfast service ...Real yummy ;) But be aware of the dodgy taxi drivers (the taxi stand in front of the hotel). THye tried to rip me off couple of times, with incorrect misinformation...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nzkes
Reviews.Content: Just what you need for a long flight to the UK. Clean, Tidy and the buffet breakfast is great. 5 min from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good introduction to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: wonder-luster
Reviews.Content: We got a night's stay as transit passengers, courtesy of Emirates. The check in and check out was very efficient and staff ( from transit counter to restaurant waiters ) friendly and informative. We were given vouchers for drinks and 2 meals-buffet spread is surprisingly good. Room was comfortable and big for the 3 of us. Only grouse was the poor drainage in the bath and the slippery floor when wet. It provides a good introduction to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “UNFRIENDLY staff”
Reviews.Author: SusiePCalx
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was not our call. My husband slipped on a wet floor with no warning signs when at the Dubai airport and fractured his hip. Emirates airlines was kind enough to set us up at this place for one night, with meal vouchers. When I went down to get dinner with the vouchers I explained the situation (how we had just been an entire day at the ER etc.) and was denied taking two plates of food upstairs. The person implied that since it was a buffett, I'd be taking advantage and sort of stealing food. The result? Room service, which was absolutely not worth it's cost. Additionally, we were not allowed to place international calls if not before paying $100 deposit. There was no understanding for our dire situation since my husband couldn't be left unattended. We were promised that someone would come up with a wireless card reader, but they never showed up. The day after, despite leaving the 100 USD deposit, it took ONE HOUR of bouncing between reception and operator to make our first call (Operator: you need to pay Me: I did Operator: call the reception to confirm; Reception: It's active tell the operator; Operator: the line isn't active - and so forth for one hour...). The following morning we woke up late due to previous exhausting day. We called the restaurant seeing if they would let me get food and again they denied. When my husband called Room service, he was told that breakfast was not served after 10:30 and it was literally 10:32. I went down, infuriated since my husband needed the food to take his pain medication and the manager promised to have two breakfasts brought up. My husband called down at 12:00 and the manager said that NOW he would ask. Ridiculous right? They didn't care about the situation at all. The only good thing of the hotel was Mario the porter who was always smiling and assisting with the wheelchair - before getting any tips. All in all, a disgusting experience where "customer service" are two words that were left by the management and staff out of the Millennium's front door.

Reviews.Title: “More like a motel than hotel; good for a stopover but not much else”
Reviews.Author: sailornep5
Reviews.Content: If I had to actually pay the posted room rates for this hotel, I would have been more upset....but I received the room free of charge from Emirates as part of their long stopover program, so with that I was pleased for what I got gratis. I would venture to guess 90% of the guests at this hotel are here from Emirates; the staff seemed to be very adept at shuttling people in and out of the hotel. The rooms are clean, spacious, but very no-frills - the towels are thin and scratchy; the shampoo comes in packets; the prisoner grade bar shop generates no suds. But the beds are soft and the TV (with about five watchable channels) works....not that you're watching it anyway considering you'll want to fall asleep quickly before the alarm gets you up. Which leads to how ridiculously early they wake you up here - over two hours prior to your flight, despite it being literally five minutes away from the airport. You do not have a say in this matter - you arrive, tell them your flight, and they schedule your wake up call. We questioned this practice on our first stay here - really? We need to wake up at 3am for our 6am flight? - and were told that there are so many flights at that hour that Customs could be backed up. So we did....only to arrive to a virtually empty airport. Thank goodness McDonald's at the airport was open to keep us busy for the next two hours. So on the way back, we told them we really wanted more time; that we'd be okay with only an hour notice.....we were told it was not an option. So once again we were bored to death at the airport (since security was yet again only two people long). I guess they have to do it that way to best schedule the rooms since they are just a revolving welcome mat for Emirates passengers. One last note....most guests receive a free buffet ticket during their stay (which, by the way, is actually much, much better than I would have expected). I ate dinner and breakfast twice and watched as about 5% of the guests, despite getting a free meal, did not leave any tips to the hard working staff. I felt bad because the wait staff there was so friendly and worked like bumblebees trying to clean up plates, refill glasses, etc.....just because it's a buffet doesn't mean you shouldn't tip something! :)

Reviews.Title: “I always love hotels in Dubai!”
Reviews.Author: craiglegrice
Reviews.Content: Dubai knows how to extend a warm welcome, any time of the year. I wasn't expecting the usual hospitality to necessarily be present at the airport but this hotel was comfortable, elegant, luxurious and well appointed. A short stay was made extra enjoyable by the great food and relaxing leisure facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: donna084
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, rooms were very clean and elegent infact good value for money will surly return and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location if stop over”
Reviews.Author: Aobisi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very near Dubai International Airport. My group and me were allocated to this hotel due to a flight delay / mis-connection. The room is spacious and cosy. But no toiletries are given. There is a nearby mall but did not have the time as it closed by the time we are allocated there. There is the last night tour offered by the hotel at USD30 though.

Reviews.Title: “Better than many I've paid for!”
Reviews.Author: How-did-I-get-here
Reviews.Content: Put up here by Emirates on a stopover. Hotel is close to airport (~10mins by complimentary minibus). Rooms were very nice; clean, modern, good shower, tv - what more could you ask for when staggering off a flight from Sydney? Reception very efficient at processing airplane-loads of people at one time. I asked about meals and received some very useful complimentary vouchers - don't know if everyone gets these or only if you ask! The restaurant was very good, loads on offer buffet-style. The 'new wing' is a marble palace and there is apparently still work going on although no signs of this while we were there. We took a walk down the street - not much to see around the hotel though and it's damned hot once you step out of the air conditioned interior. (For interest, out the hotel to the right about 100yds there is a bus stop, which is airconditioned! - and frankly that was about as far as we could have gone without recovering in the shelter!) Not bad at all. I've paid (directly) for worse.

Reviews.Title: “good in-transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsRM
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in transit to europe as arranged by emirates airline (so we did not book it ourselves). the check in staff were friendly and efficient. the hotel is not new and there was a fair walk to the rooms through the hotel (make sure your cabin bag has wheels!) The rooms were simple and modern , and the bathrooms had been updated.There was some noise as you can imagine with in transit people coming and going in the hallways .The dinner provided was buffet style and the food was tasty and good quiality and variety and fresh. And again at breakfast it was also more than adequate. the airport shuttle that they run is frequent enough and efficient when we used it. the hotel is near the airport , only recomended for in-transit staying. it did not have a pool which would have been nice on arrving.

Reviews.Title: “stop-over airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankenreiter
Reviews.Content: you will get this hotel from Emirates when you stop-over in dubai and your wait is longer than 8hrs. the bus transfer s included but once at the hotel there is not much to do. tours are offered, but kind of over-priced. the rooms are spacious, with only a small window a little dark, but other then this clean and simple. the food is included and quite good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tonytravel8899
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, ideal for my purpose with very friendly and helpful staff. I will definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but pricey transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheLuckyDucky
Reviews.Content: If I could sum up this hotel in one word it would be adequate. The rooms are cozy and clean, and that's about it. There is no character to this hotel whatsoever, but it is an alright place to get a bit of sleep before a flight. The food and the excellent staff are the best things about this place. Everything else is just dull. There isn't a lot around the hotel, and nothing to do in the hotel and even if you want to use the internet it is really expensive. I would only stay here again if I had to, (say if I was en route to somewhere else) .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Minnesota55303
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Millennium on four separate occasions since November. The first time i was welcomed and the other three times welcomed back by genuine, friendly staff. They have helped me plan excursions, offered useful advice, made great recommendations and made me feel at home and like a truly appreciated guest. In addition, the breakfast is great, the room always clean and pleasant. Room service is reasonably priced, quick and the food excellent; the rooms are pleasant and the beds comfortable. The only addition i would like is a tea maker in my room (there was one on my first visit). I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to my next visit. Diane Bemel U.S.A

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ClintVB
Reviews.Content: A night's accommodation with meals and transfers provided by Emirate Airlines. We had read other reviews, some mixed but our experience was very positive and pleasant. The hotel wasn't that far from the shopping malls (why else do you visit Dubai) and the taxis and Metro rail make moving about easy. We only had the one day and night in Dubai to 'tick the box' after spending several months in other Middle Eastern countries but found all the people in the hotel, airport etc helpful and friendly (unlike some grumpy ME airport people (Qatar)) For a longer stay you may choose another hotel but for a short stopover this is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for stopover.......”
Reviews.Author: dwaip
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near to the Airport and well run and efficient. Check in is quick, airport transfers are painless. Wake-up call facility is very helpful as you will never miss a flight. One can even check with the staff at a desk in the lobby for a reasonably priced 2- or 4-hour tour of Dubai. The rooms very clean, quiet & spacious. Free vouchers for Lunch, Dinner & Breakfast are available at the counter while check-in. All were buffets open for several hours each day the buffet meals provided were excellent with much variety to suit everyone. Good value for money and I recommend to all my friends !

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: ozpix
Reviews.Content: Our enjoyable stay in this hotel was for a 1 night stopover courtesy of Emirates Airlines as our connecting flight was not until the next day. The airport is only about 5 mins away & the hotel is fairly modern & very clean & effecient. The room was huge & had everything we needed. We were on the ground floor so we did hear the occasional noise of people walking by our room along the corridor but it was not a problem. They gave us free vouchers for Lunch, Dinner & Breakfast & all were buffets open for several hours each day. We also took up their offer for a cheap city tour. It went for about 4 or so hours & gave us a great insight into the amazing city of Dubai. Some of Dubai's great attractions such as the Burj kalifa building are only about a 15 min cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a 1 night stop over compliments of Emirates”
Reviews.Author: Jas1959
Reviews.Content: Having read prior reviews didn't quite know what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The staff were efficient, the rooms very clean, quiet & spacious. The buffet meals provided were excellent with much variety to suit everyone. We joined our flgiht the next day well rested & very well fed. Note: The only toiletires supplied in the bathroom was soap & shampoo. Enjoyed this hotel. Jas/Stu - from Australia

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, quiet room near airport, good buffet”
Reviews.Author: SFNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Emirates wing during two transit stops (each way ona round trip). Both rooms were quite nice, though the second room was much larger and sunnier than the first. Wifi service was not available in either room ... a friend had it in her room down the hall though. The hotel is well run and efficient. Check in is quick, airport transfers are painless, and staff at a desk in the lobby will set up a reasonably priced 2- or 4-hour tour of Dubai. (The 4 hour tour is available during the day and costs 35 dollars; the 2 hour tour is available in the evening). The 4 hour tour hit most of the highlights, including a short boat ride across the canal and a museum visit (lots of fun for adults AND kids) but not the Burj Khalifa. (HINT: If you want to visit the world's largest building, make your reservation at least a day in advance, and pay only 25-30 dollars for the pleasure, instead of 125 dollars if you just show up). Emirates seems to want to keep its passengers well-fed. Meal and snack vouchers seem to rain upon you at check in, good for the buffet-style cafeteria. Food is available 24 hours, and dinner is served until 12:30 a.m. The buffet is pretty decent ... a reasonable variety of western and asian specialties, including pastas and curries for lunch and dinner. Yeah, the corridors of the hotel are long alright, as others have mentioned. This is a big hotel that can seem on the impersonal side. It is great for transit passengers, and it's free if you are traveling on Emirates. Otherwise, it may be worth staying closer the action if you have more time (e.g., near the Spice Souk and Museum in the "old" part of Dubai). The other wing of the hotel, accessible through a courtyard, has a business center.

Reviews.Title: “Endless corridors !”
Reviews.Author: wanchaiSydney
Reviews.Content: We were only on a one night stopover courtesy of Emirates airline, however, after a long and exhausting flight from Sydney we were put in a room which felt about two kilometres down the corridor from reception. It was so far we couldn't see the other end of the corridor. The room looked out onto a building site and was a very gloomy outlook for our welocme to Dubai ! We were given copious meal vouchers which was a bonus and the buffet meals were quite acceptable and staff courteous and friendly. Would not stay there if i had to pay though !

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, worth the price”
Reviews.Author: rosey10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great - a must for weary travellers breaking up their trip in Dubai. The rooms are exquisite - every detail is thought of. The rooms are huge, the bathrooms are huge - the beds were like sleeping on clouds. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay. Ruse staff”
Reviews.Author: James_100LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: very poor experiance. the staff made a very rude/low comment to my wife and I complained to the Manager who basically done nothing. As we were foreigners in there, I did not want to do too much but I will complain to the highest authority of that hotel to ensure action is taken against that staff member

Reviews.Title: “It was free”
Reviews.Author: KOONy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Millennium Hotel because of a long connection with Emirates and hence the hotel was paid for by the airline. The hotel was below the level of what I expected from a Millennium Hotel. I felt it was more of a 2 star hotel. The room we had was very basic. 2 single bed and a shower. The room (4088) and shower had a strange odor. Not sure why. Carpet was dirty. No wash clothes and when I asked for it, the said they do not have wash clothes at the hotel. The vouchers for meals was geat and the restaurant had a decent amount of choices (buffet style) Basically we stayed there because it was free. Will not stay there again if I had a choice of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai Trip”
Reviews.Author: apsingh
Reviews.Content: Dubai trip was wonderful, stay in Millenium hotel was awesome. I enjoyed my time in Dubai, I would love to go to Dubai again and stay in same hotel. People were nice and helped me in visiting the Dubai city and famous places

Reviews.Title: “Boxy hotel without any character”
Reviews.Author: Lucozade_Princess
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel used by Emirates to house its transit passengers. There is nothing to recommend it except for the fact that it is clean and the free food (from the airlines if you are in transit) is quite passable. I stayed in room 0032 which must be at least a 200m walk from the Emirates lobby or the restaurant down at least a 100m long corridor with all the charm and character of a hospital corridor. If you are out and about and plan to take a taxi back to the hotel then ask him to specifically drop you back at the Emirates wing. There is another part of the hotel which looked quite posh from its lobby where the taxi drivers invariably drop you. To get to the Emirates wing from this entrance you have to walk through the lobby of the main wing, through the outdoor restaurants and a small garden with construction going around it. After all this walking you reach the lobby of the Emirates wing and realize that another 200m walk is still left before you reach your room. The wired/wireless connection is prohibitively expensive at some 50 Dhs/hour or 90 Dhs/day. There are 2 salons, one each for men and women which is again priced on the higher side for the kind of service it provides. The Emirates wing is at best a 2.5 star hotel with obscenely priced paid facilities, i would not stay here if i had to pay for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NamanAgarwal
Reviews.Content: Good business class hotel with spacious rooms and the right price. It is very well located and is easily accessible. Food is just OK and service is average. All in all a good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: AussieChook
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in this airport hotel, which is about 5 - 10 mins taxi ride from the airport. There are other hotels in the same location now so the choice has improved. The Millenium hotel is used as the free stopover hotel for Emirates passengers if they have poor connections. The reception is geared towards clearing clients through very quickly and it was efficient if impersonal. You're issued with vouchers for dinner, late snack and breakfast if you're on a free stopover, which is excellent value. The meals were buffet style, soft drinks were included and I have no complaints about any of the meals. The room however was a different matter. Avoid the rooms on the ground floor that have no carpet as the passage of other clients would make the room very noisy as they tramp past to get to the lifts. I stayed at the end of the ground floor corridor and there was carpet on the corridor so noise wasn't too bad. The room is extremely basic. No in-room safe was the major issue along with no hair dryer (had to ask reception for one, when it came it shorted the electricity supply to the room, so we had to ask for another hair dryer in the morning - why don't they have one in the bathroom attached to the wall if they are so concerned about theft?). The toiletries were very substandard for a three half star property and shampoo was in a sachet. The hotel is not concerned about clients staying for one night and therefore this is a very basic hotel. Considering it was free, I can't complain about the price but no hair dryer is stupid! If you don't get a free stopover, look for other hotels in the same location - they are bound to be better

Reviews.Title: “Rip off for tel, wireless and extras”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here free courtesy Emirates because of 12 hr stop in Dubai. Millenium staff very bureaucratic and go by the book. Check out is at 8 am and no flexibility on that. Nowehre in the world have I come across an 8 am check out bar. Required a hundred US dollar deposit if I wanted to make an international call from my room, and the balance would be refunded not in dollars but in dhirams. Declined that and made a call from the reception desk at five US dollars a minute. Internet/wireless is not free and costs about fifteen US dollars for two hours. An extra half liter bottle of drinking water is eighteen dhirams (which makes it about five US dollars). I walked across the road to the local supermarket and purchased the same for one dhiram. Beer with your meals is about six dollars a can. They could improve the no of TV channels - seemed to me there were just two in English and six in all. So whats good - well you get to stay near the airport courtesy Emirates in a hotel which is certainly not four stars as claimed by the hotel but rather two stars, and you get vouchers for free meals during your stay, and the meals are eat as much as you want buffets and adequate. Free shuttle to hotel and back, with rude driver on return to airport trip who shouted at one passenger who wanted to enter the van with his carry on luggage as you are supposed to put that in the trailer at the back. Why should anybody automatically know that?

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate for a layover”
Reviews.Author: BusanDayzee
Reviews.Content: THis was part of a 22hr layover between South Africa and South Korea. It was a complimentary service and although we were in the furthest room possible, it was clean, comfortable. cool and dark enough to get some much needed sleep! The staff I did encounter in the hallways were very friendly and willing to help with a smile, much appreciated in the early hourss of the morning!

Reviews.Title: “nicely kept indeed”
Reviews.Author: abdullah1425
Reviews.Content: Organised tours of Dubai leave from here! A regular service to the shopping mall also departs from here which is free of charge for Emirates Economy customers. The corridors seem to go on forever so bear this in mind if you don't really like walking around in search of your room!

Reviews.Title: “OK, nothing remarkable”
Reviews.Author: Coltbridge
Reviews.Content: A quick stopover. Large roomy room, comfy bed, large comfy bathroom, aircon worked OK. Basicallly a competent hotel at a reasonable (£100) price. My only complaint was that though a non-smoking room there was a distinct cigar tang, but I guess in the gulf "non-smoking" is more a request than a rule!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel for Dubai prices”
Reviews.Author: The-M0M0
Reviews.Content: I returned from China onwards to Sana'a and stayed only half a day in this hotel. It was clean but so far over priced that it just was not fun any more and it proves my general idea about the Emirates and Dubai in particular. I will never stay in this hotel again because for this price... you'll have a lot better. Even so, the hotel was boring, food expensive and not specially good. For me, never again

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for transit in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Barricuda
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for a night while in transit. The rooms are dull, nothing much to write home about. Got a free coupon for the dinner buffet in the restaurant which was not great either. Its all right to use this hotel only if you are on a short/overnight transit stop in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Kings and Queens”
Reviews.Author: HighSkyFly
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Airport Hotel was merely a stop over for my family and I on our way to Australia; although I must say, it was certainly a worthwhile experience. Despite having only stayed there what must have been eight hours, the hotel was immaculate and accommodating to say the least. As someone who has travelled around the World, I pretty much expected that being an airport hotel, this one would be as bad as all of the others. Whilst is wasn't the epitome of luxury, my family and I were lost for words at the service this hotel has on offer. The restaurant was a prime example of our delight: the staff were switched on and if possible, overly helpful. The rooms are quite and particularly spacious, although no complimentary food and drink was on offer. Asides from this there is no doubt that in a bag, The Millennium Airport Hotel is a more than pleasant stay for a stop over or connection in Dubai. You will be treated like Kings and Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Horror - Building Site”
Reviews.Author: I_need_a_hols
Reviews.Content: This is where Emirates will stick you if you are a business traveller who has a flight delay. Horrible and a building site. Demand an upgrade

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Price - Three Star Soul”
Reviews.Author: Rory K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the years. It began as a cheap and cheerful indepent three stars (if that) property but one with good quality and good value F&B outlets and a cheerful and welcoming staff. Since (massive) redevelopment a lot of the soul has gone out of the place while prices have risen sharply both for rooms and (more importantly) F&B. While the rooms are acceptable, the word "austere" springs to mind and although formally a 4-Star property, it somehow does not feel like that. Acceptable if close to airport location is vital but if not, there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for few hours transit”
Reviews.Author: DeadSeaFisherman
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the Millenium Airport hotel consists of 2 different divisions, the one which Emirates airline exclusivly use for its transit passengers ( the one I stayed in) , other part I think it is much better and more luxurious. The transit part is ok for few hours connection, clean, food is not bad, rooms are spacious, very small TV with 8 channels only, bath room is spacious and clean but no complimentary slippers, no tooth brush or paste, no shaving kit, so be sure to take yours or you need to buy from lobby gift shop. Internet is not free it cost 15 dollars per hour, location is very close to airport and the nice City Center mall, acroos street to the fantastic Meridien hotel which has a great collection of restaurants and cafe's, but you can not go walking to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not good. Pretty average but clean.”
Reviews.Author: MistyLaw2
Reviews.Content: Okay for a one-night stopover. We were in the Emirates wing enroute to Sydney from Glasgow. We were at the hotel in minutes after getting on the minibus outside the new Emirates terminal. Its very convenient and the rooms are clean. I would only stay here as a stop-over though, for a shower and a bed. The corridors are long and dull and the rooms very plain. I felt I was herded about and the staff barely made eye contact when checking in. It was a bit of a conveyor belt. We were given a voucher for a snack, a drink and a sandwich and breakfast which had a good selection. Picked up from hotel and dropped off at airport the next morning. The hotel did what it said on the tin but not much more. It served its purpose but don't expect anything more than a basic Travelodge style property.

Reviews.Title: “glad of a nice bed to have a nap”
Reviews.Author: carefulsun
Reviews.Content: we had a nine hour stop over in Dubai on our way home from Melbourne after a fourteen hour non-stop flight it was lovely to know we would be able to have a nice shower and stretch our legs...when we found the hotel desk which i have to say was a five day camel hike the staff were very helpful and the transfer was there in about 10 mins at the hotel the staff were very helpful again and check-in took about 2 mins at which point they gave us food vouchers for breakfast, lunch and snacks which was fantastic and very unexpected the room was very large, lovely, clean and the beds were very comfortable they had left us towels shampoo etc we were very impressed with this hotel and the staff everything went very smoothly and we got back on the plane feeling refreshed and clean.we would like to thank emirates for this lovely break in our flight it was fantastic..

Reviews.Title: “A very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: female-tourist
Reviews.Content: On my outward, journey I had 10 hours between flights and Emirates offered me a room at the airport hotel, for which I was grateful. But I was rather surprised to be told I was not allocated to their own hotel, but to the Millennium Hotel. The shuttle bus arrived at the hotel just before 1.00am with about 20-25 passengers. Check-in was dreadfully dreadfully slow and I was in the queue for 20 minutes, and there were several people after me. Why did it take so long? I was offered a voucher for dinner (which I declined) but accepted the vouchers for snacks and breakfast. I went to the dining area to get a hot chocolate and a piece of cake. I was told I was not allowed to take china or cutlery to my room. So I had my drink in a cardboard cup and the cake was wrapped in a paper napkin. This is not what I would expect of a 5-star hotel. My room was at the front of the building and I had a very noisy night. The shuttle bus driver and porters made a lot of noise and then there was a lot of noise in the corridor, which I discovered was the baggage porters shouting at each other. And this is the early hours of the morning!!! I certainly did not get the restful night I had hoped for. Next morning, I came to breakfast at 7.30 and found a good selection of food, but the waiters were very slow at replenishing the empty dishes. I waited a full 5 minutes for the coffee. I returned to my room just after 8.00 and the phone rang. A voice said very abruptly "your check out time was 8.00, will you check out NOW" I came downstairs and said to the receptionist that I was not aware that check-out was 8.00. He just smiled and walked away. Just rudeness! I do remember being told by Emirates staff that I should get a shuttle bus about 9.00am and no later than 9.30. But if I was told about the 8.00 check-out I have no recollection, perhaps I was just too tired at 1.00am I do not think any of this is the behaviour you would expect of staff at a 5-star hotel. My room was clean and comfortable, but there was no coffee maker as stated in the hotel description. I hope if I have another airport stopover, I am allocated to another hotel and not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly unhelpful manager”
Reviews.Author: byomkesh
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at Millennium during a one-night lay over in Dubai. Efficient transfers to/from airport, room and buffet were adequate and fine. The negatives however, outnumber the positives: The staff is very bureaucratic -- they will insist you take the shuttle 3 hours before your flight even if you already have your boarding pass and you have no baggage to check in. I completely ignored that and took a later shuttle and still had more than ample time at the Airport. No WiFi, not even in the lobby. The "business center" comprises of 2 computers, quite inadequate. But the most terrible experience was the following: The ATM in the lobby malfunctioned and swallowed the card. The ATM was known to malfunction to the staff, and yet the manager took absolutely no responsibility. In fact the manager Mr. Zaarob, he accused us of entering the wrong password. Would not authorize a 5minute phone call to Australia to cancel the card (said we had to pay $5/minute). At one point offered to give "in writing" that the card was safe, and when we accepted, immediately rescinded the offer saying "his superiors won't allow it". The manager of the Emirates wing, Mr. Jihad Nasser was even less helpful. He yelled at us, said we shouldn't bother him or his staff with our story. Terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “can't find any faults”
Reviews.Author: Thefall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the connection in Dubai and couldn't find any faults. Quick shuttle transfer from the airport, fast check-in. I was given three vouchers - for dinner, breakfast and refreshments in the bar (and that is very convenient). The room was adequate for 4*, although the bathroom floor was a bit dirty and walls were stained in some places. Nevertheless, there was a bath, shower and bed - all you need to have a rest before the long flight. Regarding the problems with wake-up call - well, I guess everybody has a phone which has a wake-up ringtone. Why rely on the reception? By the way, the breakfast and dinner were nice - lots of fruits, juices, plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: stormo
Reviews.Content: We were put in this hotel by Emirates as we had an 8 hour stay over in Dubai on the way to Australia. There is not really too much to say about the Emirates side of the hotel. It is clean, the rooms are very big and the staff are helpful. The breakfast buffet was was quite nice. There 2 shops, 2 pubs and a restaurant in the hotel although by the time we got there they were closed. Not a bad place to stay at all for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “very expensive”
Reviews.Author: davidTR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Airport hotel for one night between flights. The transfer by their own bus was quick and smooth (they have their own desk at the far end of the airport, clearly signed) The staff were very pleasant and the large room was excellent although your sleep may be disturbed by aircraft noises at night. We had an expensive ok snack including an average glass of white wine and a nice pot of tea. We failed to get our requested wakeup call. The room rate was very expensive, 1980 dhms (approx £362, invoice says "room charges " so presumably doesn't include breakfast. This may partly be due to the weak value of the pound. I think that Dubai has had its day - the hotel was very quiet. They are still building in Dubai, hopefully the hotel prices will come down as there is more competition.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to set your alarm”
Reviews.Author: ilovefeta
Reviews.Content: We were staying in the Millennium for only one night as part of an Emirates stopover. We arrived just before midnight and had a flight out the next morning at 8:00am. At check-in, the counter staff went over details with us such as our flight details for tomorrow and what time we would like our wake up call. They had arranged a call for 6am but I requested an earlier call for 5:30am as I wanted to squeeze in a spot of shopping at the airport. After this we went to our room. The room is more than adequate for an overnight stopover. Clean, comfy beds, nice shower etc etc. The problem came the next morning. My boyfriend and I were dead asleep when our phone rang (the wake up call) telling us it was time to check out. I sat up and checked my phone - it was 7:20am. We freaked out and ran out of our room so fast down to the check out desk. When I got there, I was not happy. I told the staff member our wake up call was for two hours ago and we were not contacted any earlier and there is a good chance we are going to miss our flight. All 10 other staff members behind the counter went silent and looked away. The one guy who would talk to me suggested a cab - I asked if he was going to pay for it and he promptly suggested the bus. The bus arrived 1 minute later so we jumped on. Turns out there was another traveller sitting next to us for the same flight that they failed to wake up. We made our gate by 10 minutes. Overall, for an airport stopover hotel, the wake up call incident is unforgiveable. They of all people should realise the importance of getting such details correct.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a Stopover”
Reviews.Author: tez823
Reviews.Content: Emirates put us up here for a stopover. Very basic but large room. Interconnecting door to next room meant we could hear everything going on there so not easy to get to sleep. Good large bathroom and great breakfast to get us on our way for the next leg of our journey. Persistent wake up calls. Really close to the airport and completely buffered from external noise so all in all very convenient for stopover - especially with shuttle bus every half hour. Note: If you only have a short stopover - get your luggage checked through to your final destination from your departure port and carry on an overnight bag so you don't have to wait to collect your luggage when you arrive in Dubai as it can take up to an hour longer just to get your luggage. For a short stay it's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: HavanaMan
Reviews.Content: On a 9 hour layover in Dubai Emirates booked me at the 'Commercial Wing' - which is not the rundown area where EK usually puts up their passengers. It was a surprisingly large room, though not a 5* rated hotel I found it more pleasant than some of the higher rated properties in Dubai. Nice place, convenient location to the airport and complimentary limousine service (by the hotel not Emirates) to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel For The Money”
Reviews.Author: Manwithplan
Reviews.Content: One of the advantages this hotel has is its proximity to the Airport. However, building work is on-going in the area so getting to and from it can be a bit of a journey. Freindly staff. Good restraunts and bars and the rooms are, if a little worn in some areas, very comfortable. Other services, like laundry, room service, etc good although room internet access (wired) is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: JennieLGreenwod
Reviews.Content: This was a very relaxing 6-night stop. The location is great for everything in Dubai. The Staff & facilities at the hotel are amongst the best I have come across. With the choice of 3 in hotel different dining experiences there is definitely one for everyone. I wouldn’t necessarily say it was suitable for children.

Reviews.Title: “Simple But Nice”
Reviews.Author: kobusingye
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with all the basic amenities in place. The carpet in the rooms looked rather worn, and the beddings appeared dated. Aside from that, the service was great. Dinner was very nice... buffet style. Staff were friendly... the wake-up calls came on time. Cannot complain. It is a very short distance to the airport is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Gruwe
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights . hotel was ok if not a little date in terms of decor. Could not fault the staff and the food was ok. Very popular with business men . Pool was ok, clean and seperate changing rooms. Very near the airport but you would never know the only down side is that its quite far from Jumeriah and the other popular areas. Idea for business but for a holiday expect to get a lot of taxis, too far to walk in the heat

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Sandplustwo
Reviews.Content: I arranged this hotel through my travelagent because of a 14 hour stopover in Dubai. I was travelling as a single woman with two teenage children. The hotel reception area is very nice and shiney and new, but we were then escorted to what was euphemistically called the 'garden rooms', which turned out to be a motel-style family room in the middle of a courtyard. It was appalling. Although clean, the rooms and bathrooms looked little changed from the late 1960's. It would barely have been more than one-star. We were the only ones in this area, and I felt very uncomfortable and isolated the entire night. When we breakfasted in the main hotel building the following morning, it was then I realised that accompanied women (with male partners) and business men were accommodated in the main building. I couldn't get out of there fast enough. Close vicinity to the airport or not, this is not a hotel I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Especially for a freebie”
Reviews.Author: Get-away-go
Reviews.Content: We were delayed for 24 hours in Dubai on our return trip from the Maldives and Emirates put us up in the Millenium. Emirates have a wing of the hotel reserved for them with their own check in/customer services and buffet restaurant. The hotel is about 10 mins by mini bus from the airport with transfers running every 30 minutes. Very nice rooms - with comfortable beds. Buffet was very good - we were given vouchers for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner plus light refreshments. Soft drinks were included in the buffet, alcohol is not - Alcoholic drinks are a bit on the pricey side as I found out when I ordered a couple of beers!!! On the negative side - we asked for our cases to be sent on to the hotel so that we had a change of clothes and washing gear for our stay. My wifes case arrived 6 hours later but mine never made it despite several phone calls to Emirates Customer Services and direct to the baggage handlers at Dubai Airport. Spending 48 hours in jeans and t shirt without a change of clothes in 40deg c termperatures is not the most pleasant experience. Although cant mark the hotel down for this. So if you get delayed in Dubai and get told you are off to the Millenium Hotel dont fear - it is not a bad experience at all.

HotelInfo.Name: Millennium Airport Hotel Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: Airport Road, Casablanca Street | Al Garhoud, PO Box 13018, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
